page.title: 05ENTERTAINMENT IN TRELAWNYD
page.content: Trelawnyd Male Voice Choir was formed 58 years ago by the Village Headmaster,and since then it has grown in strength and popularity. There are now 97 members of which 90% are welsh speakers. Two of the founder members still sing regularly with the Choir. The Choir has 0ften featured on television and radio programmes, and have made their own records. The catchment area of the members stretches from Mold and Flint to Llanbedr and Abergele. They rehearse in the Village Hall twice a week thoughout the year. Two popular Festival Concerts are held in Trelawnyd when the choir entertains top class artists.The choir average twelve concerts a year and although their repertoire includes songs of many different languages,though 25% is in welsh
